name: pigheadedly
content:
Add to word list

in a way that is pigheaded (= refusing to change or listen to different opinions): The party pigheadedly opposed the repeal of the law. If you're determined to be so pigheadedly stubborn and blind to the truth, so be it. See
pigheaded
More examplesFewer examplesHe had reputation for pigheadedly throwing away his talent.They deserve only condemnation for pigheadedly insisting on loyalty to persons over loyalty to country.Most of the men are pleasant, but some of them are pigheadedly ignorant.
